description.raw:
@_jrivero_ brought up this idea when it was discovered ignition-math2 and ignition-math3 could not be installed side-by-side. This PR adds an inline namespace with the project's major version.

~~Right now only `Angle` has the inline namespace. If it looks alright to any reviewers, I'll copy/paste the changes in `Angle.hh` and `Angle.cc` to all other files.~~

How users write code is unchanged (i.e. `ignition::math::Angle::HalfPi`), but the symbol has a different name.

```
$ nm install/lib/libignition-math4.so | grep Half
000000000026e9f0 B _ZN8ignition4math2v45Angle6HalfPiE
$ c++filt _ZN8ignition4math2v45Angle6HalfPiE
ignition::math::v4::Angle::HalfPi
```

**EDIT: Ready to review**
 
Versioned inline namespaces are implemented everywhere. There is also a linux only test to make sure there are no unversioned symbols. It uses the command `nm` to list the symbols in the library.
description.html:
@jrivero brought up this idea when it was discovered ignition-math2 and ignition-math3 could not be installed side-by-side. This PR adds an inline namespace with the project's major version.

Right now only Angle has the inline namespace. If it looks alright to any reviewers, I'll copy/paste the changes in Angle.hh and Angle.cc to all other files.

How users write code is unchanged (i.e. ignition::math::Angle::HalfPi), but the symbol has a different name.

$ nm install/lib/libignition-math4.so | grep Half
000000000026e9f0 B _ZN8ignition4math2v45Angle6HalfPiE
$ c++filt _ZN8ignition4math2v45Angle6HalfPiE
ignition::math::v4::Angle::HalfPi

EDIT: Ready to review

Versioned inline namespaces are implemented everywhere. There is also a linux only test to make sure there are no unversioned symbols. It uses the command nm to list the symbols in the library.
